content:
Unicode characters in declaration names are pretty annoying, and I don't see any reason why Mem‚Ñíp needs to have a unicode character in the name. Shall we just replace the ‚Ñí with a regular L?

Reasons why it is annoying:

  • More annoying to type
  • docs#MeasureTheory.Mem‚Ñíp
  • No results found here: https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/404.html#MeasureTheory.Mem%E2%84%92
  • The character ‚Ñí / ‚Ñí looks quite different in various fonts (for me, these two occurrences of the same character are displayed very differently)
I think the reason is that usually ‚Ñíp is used to denote the set of functions with integrable power p while Lp is for the quotient set. But I agree this is quite annoying and not very useful.
That was the reason, but I agree it's annoying to use and and we should change it.
Do these comments also apply to docs#Mem‚Ñìp ? (edit: lol at least one of them seems to)
I basically never use the docs for anything related to Lp spaces precisely because it's so hard to type
Does such a name change require deprecating all lemmas with an ‚Ñí in the name, or is just the definitions sufficient? (I think I know the answer but I don't like it)

How difficult would it be to

  • make loogle support entering the L well?
  • make doc-gen support the same unicode input options?

Deprecating many lemmas is painful, to what extent would this already help?
How difficult would it be to write a script which deprecates all declarations with an ‚Ñí in?

Michael Rothgang said:

How difficult would it be to

  • make loogle support entering the L well?
  • make doc-gen support the same unicode input options?

Deprecating many lemmas is painful, to what extent would this already help?

Loogle already supports Unicode input.

The script already exists: scripts/add_deprecations.sh

Oh nice! I didn't know the script, so I did some regex-replace myself. Is the script idempotent? I think I missed a few deprecations.
#22164 builds now, and a speedy review would be appreciated, since it likely rots quickly.

I know! I guess I have a bug report then, in that I cannot make loogle find results with "Memùìõp". Never mind: copy-pasting the name from the docs works. But using \MCL to type a curly L fails, as that is a different unicode L.
